intro: Trichosanthes olida, commonly known as the African horned melon, is a climbing vine native to Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces large, spiky, green fruits that turn orange when ripe. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs. The fruit has a thick, bumpy rind and a sweet, honey-like flavor when mature.
